page.title: 01 GENERAL
page.content: This area, consisting mainly of the village of Rainford and the hamlets of Crank and King's Moss, lies about 15 miles from central Liverpool.The nearest big town is St.Helens,but Skel- mersdale New Town is not far away.Road connections are good and there is a railway station near to Rainford. Rainford is mainly a dormitory area, but Crank and King's Moss are partly dormitory,partly farming orientated. There is much grassland and the land is dotted with small copses.The Industrial Estate employs a large number of people but otherwise the main local employment is farming. Rainford and Crank are both now in Merseyside,but in the past they were in Lancashire-even now part of King's Moss is in Greater Manchester,part in Merseyside and part in Lancashire.
